messages.content: David Winnick is dedicated to Walsall North

keyPolicies.policyDescription: David was the first MP to urge free TV licences for pensioners.
Successfully campaigned for prisoners of war of the Japanese to be properly compensated.
Spoke in the Commons against the abolition of the Education Maintenance Allowance for the over sixteens.
Urged help with fuel bills for the elderly and Labour brought in winter fuel allowance.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Closure of Willenhall Crown Post Office
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaigned against closure of Willenhall Crown Post Office.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Building works for All Saints National Academy
keyPolicies.policyDescription: David remains involved in the on-going campaign for All Saints National Academy for essential building works to be carried out.

issues.brexitEurope: As a democrat, I voted in Parliament to respect the decision taken in the referendum in leaving the EU, and I want an outcome that fully protects the interests of the Black Country.
issues.education: Spoke in the Commons against the abolition of the Education Maintenance Allowance for the over sixteens.
issues.government: We need a government that cares, a Labour government.
issues.health: The NHS, social care and other essential services which are already short of funding, could well be in line for further harsh Tory cuts.
issues.socialWelfare: The last Labour government helped pensioners with the national bus pass and pension credit and the winter fuel allowance - all opposed previously by the Tories.

community.content: David remains involved in the on-going campaign for All Saints National Academy for essential building works to be carried out.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have always tried to be the voice of Walsall North at Westminster & if re-elected I pledge to continue to be so.

politicalExperience.achievements: David was the first MP to urge free TV licences for pensioners. Successfully campaigned for prisoners of war of the Japanese to be properly compensated. Fought for substantial work to be carried out on Bloxwich Academy.

endorsements.endorsement: David has worked tirelessly for Walsall North and remains one of the hardest working and capable councillors as well as a formidable team.

examples: David was the first MP to urge free TV licences for pensioners.
Successfully campaigned for prisoners of war of the Japanese to be properly compensated.
We need a government that cares, a Labour government.
The NHS, social care and other essential services which are already short of funding, could well be in line for further harsh Tory cuts.
I have always tried to be the voice of Walsall North at Westminster & if re-elected I pledge to continue to be so.
David has worked tirelessly for Walsall North and remains one of the hardest working and capable councillors as well as a formidable team.
David remains involved in the on-going campaign for All Saints National Academy for essential building works to be carried out.
Campaigned against closure of Willenhall Crown Post Office.
We need a government that cares, a Labour government.
Cllr Sean Coughlan, Labour leader, endorses David Winnick.
Successfully campaigned for substantial work to be carried out on Bloxwich Academy.
The NHS, social care and other essential services which are already short of funding, could well be in line for further harsh Tory cuts.
The last Labour government helped pensioners with the national bus pass and pension credit and the winter fuel allowance - all opposed previously by the Tories.
The Tories, who had a member of Walsall Council last year.
You can judge from the mess local Tories got into trying to choose a general election candidate, the kind of mess I inherited from the Tories when I became leader of Walsall Council last year.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: I have always tried to be the voice of Walsall North at Westminster & if re-elected I pledge to continue to be so.

examples: I have always tried to be the voice of Walsall North at Westminster & if re-elected I pledge to continue to be so.
